meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fractious.
meanings.sent1: The fractiousnesses of the children made it challenging to keep them quiet during the movie.
meanings.sent2: Her fractiousnesses were evident when she refused to follow the rules of the game.
meanings.sent3: The fractiousnesses of the puppy led to a comical chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The fractiousnesses of the storm could be felt in the howling winds and crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The fractiousnesses of the situation created tension among the group.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be unruly or irritable.
meanings.sent1: The fractiousnesses of the crowd grew as they waited impatiently for the show to start.
meanings.sent2: His fractiousnesses often resulted in arguments with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The fractiousnesses of the cat were evident when it refused to be petted.
meanings.sent4: The fractiousnesses of the old car were like a stubborn child resisting repair.
meanings.sent5: The fractiousnesses of the customer could be heard in the sharp tone of their voice.
